channel.title: Are there any snares that I can use for Orchestral Music?
channel.description: A few months ago, we got Orchestral Strings, and I want to create Orchestral Music, but can’t find any good snares to use. Does anyone know which snares I can use?

item.title: Are there any snares that I can use for Orchestral Music?
item.dc:creator: Thomaisho
item.description:
Try the Vintage Snares in Snaredrum Collection 2. Personally I love vintage snare 05. (May need to add some reverb and/or soften it)

Read full topic
item.source: Are there any snares that I can use for Orchestral Music?

item.title: Are there any snares that I can use for Orchestral Music?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
The Philharmonia Orchestra have a page of royalty free samples.

Philharmonia Orchestra

Sound Samples | Philharmonia Orchestra

Resident at the South Bank Centre, London. Concert and tour schedules, online booking, downloads and information on recordings, players, instruments and music education.

item.source: Are there any snares that I can use for Orchestral Music?

item.title: Are there any snares that I can use for Orchestral Music?
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
Personally think some of the shifted snares are good for orchestra music. What kind of sound you going for? I can send you the kits I’ve used for my two recent orchestra pieces if you like.

Read full topic
